ai-an8:81.1.1_0: “Mendicants, when there is no mindfulness and situational awareness, one who lacks mindfulness and situational awareness has destroyed a vital condition for conscience and prudence.
ai-an8:81.1.2_0: When there is no conscience and prudence, one who lacks conscience and prudence has destroyed a vital condition for sense restraint.
ai-an8:81.1.3_0: When there is no sense restraint, one who lacks sense restraint has destroyed a vital condition for ethical conduct.
ai-an8:81.1.4_0: When there is no ethical conduct, one who lacks ethics has destroyed a vital condition for right immersion.
ai-an8:81.1.5_0: When there is no right immersion, one who lacks right immersion has destroyed a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
ai-an8:81.1.6_0: When there is no true knowledge and vision, one who lacks true knowledge and vision has destroyed a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
ai-an8:81.1.7_0: When there is no disillusionment and dispassion, one who lacks disillusionment and dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-an8:81.1.8_0: Suppose there was a tree that lacked branches and foliage.
ai-an8:81.1.8_1: Its shoots, bark, sought, and even.
ai-an8:81.1.9_0: In the same way, when there is no mindfulness and situational awareness, one who lacks mindfulness and situational awareness has destroyed a vital condition for conscience and prudence.
ai-an8:81.1.10_0: When there is no conscience and prudence ...
ai-an8:81.1.11_0: When there is no dispassion, one who lacks dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-an8:81.2.1_0: When there is mindfulness and situational awareness, one who has fulfilled mindfulness and situational awareness has fulfilled a vital condition for conscience and prudence.
ai-an8:81.2.2_0: When there is conscience and prudence, a person who has fulfilled conscience and prudence has fulfilled a vital condition for sense restraint.
ai-an8:81.2.3_0: When there is sense restraint, one who has fulfilled sense restraint has fulfilled a vital condition for ethical conduct.
ai-an8:81.2.4_0: When there is ethical conduct, one who has fulfilled ethical conduct has fulfilled a vital condition for right immersion.
ai-an8:81.2.5_0: When there is right immersion, one who has fulfilled right immersion has fulfilled a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
ai-an8:81.2.6_0: When there is true knowledge and vision, one who has fulfilled true knowledge and vision has fulfilled a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
ai-an8:81.2.7_0: When there is disillusionment and dispassion, one who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-an8:81.2.8_0: Suppose there was a tree that was complete with branches and foliage.
ai-an8:81.2.8_1: Its shoots, bark, softwood, and responds.
ai-an8:81.2.9_0: In the same way, when there is mindfulness and situational awareness, one who has fulfilled mindfulness and situational awareness has fulfilled a vital condition for conscience and prudence.
ai-an8:81.2.10_0: When there is conscience and prudence ...
ai-an8:81.2.11_0: When there is dispassion, one who has fulfilled dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.”
ai-an8:82.1.1_0: Then venerable Puṇṇiya went to the Fortunate One,
ai-an8:82.1.1_2: He bowed, sat down to one side, and said to the Buddha,
ai-an8:82.1.2_0: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why sometimes the Realized One feels inspired to teach, and other times not?”
ai-an8:82.1.3_0: “Puṇṇiya, when a mendicant has faith but doesn’t approach,
ai-an8:82.1.4_0: the Realized One doesn’t feel inspired to teach.
ai-an8:82.1.5_0: But when a mendicant has faith and approaches,
ai-an8:82.1.6_0: the Realized One feels inspired to teach.
ai-an8:82.1.7_0: A mendicant is faithful, but doesn’t pay homage to him. ...
ai-an8:82.1.8_0: they pay homage, but don’t ask questions ...
ai-an8:82.1.9_0: they ask questions, but don’t lend an ear ...
ai-an8:82.1.10_0: they lend an ear, but don’t remember the teaching they’ve heard ...
ai-an8:82.1.11_0: they don’t remember the teachings they’ve heard ...
ai-an8:82.1.12_0: they reflect on the meaning of the teachings they’ve remembered, but, having understood the meaning and the teaching, they don’t practice accordingly.
ai-an8:82.1.13_0: The Realized One doesn’t feel inspired to teach.
ai-an8:82.2.1_0: But when a mendicant has faith, approaches, pays homage, asks questions, lends an ear, remembers the teachings, reflects on the meaning, and practices accordingly,
ai-an8:82.2.2_0: the Realized One feels inspired to teach.
ai-an8:82.2.3_0: When someone has these eight qualities, the Realized One feels totally inspired to teach.”
ai-an8:83.1.1_0: “Mendicants, if wanderers who follow other paths were to ask:
ai-an8:83.1.2_0: ‘Reverends, all things have what as their root? What produces them? What is their origin? What is their meeting place? What is their chief? What is their ruler? What is their overseer? What is their core?’ How would you answer them?”
ai-an8:83.1.3_0: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha.
ai-an8:83.1.3_1: He is our guide and our refuge.
ai-an8:83.1.3_2: The mendicants will listen and remember it.”
ai-an8:83.2.1_0: “Well then, mendicants, I will teach it.
ai-an8:83.2.2_0: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-an8:83.2.5_0: “Mendicants, if wanderers who follow other paths were to ask:
ai-an8:83.2.6_0: ‘Reverends, all things have what as their root? What produces them? What is their origin? What is their meeting place? What is their chief? What is their ruler? What is their overseer? What is their core?’
ai-an8:83.2.8_0: ‘Reverends, all things are rooted in desire. Attention produces them. Contact is their origin. Feeling is their meeting place. Immersion is their chief. Mindfulness is their ruler. Wisdom is their overseer. Freedom is their core.’
ai-an8:83.2.9_0: When questioned by wanderers who follow other paths, that’s how you should answer them.”
ai-an8:84.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a master thief with eight factors is soon executed, and doesn’t have long to live.
ai-an8:84.1.3_0: He attacks unprovoked. He steals everything without exception. He kills a woman. He rapes a girl. He robs a monk. He robs the royal treasury. He works close to home. He’s not skilled at hiding his booty.
ai-an8:84.1.4_0: A master thief with these eight factors is soon executed, and doesn’t have long to live.
ai-an8:84.2.1_0: A master thief with eight factors is not soon executed, and lives long.
ai-an8:84.2.3_0: He doesn’t attack unprovoked. He doesn’t steal everything without exception. He doesn’t kill a woman. He doesn’t rape a girl. He doesn’t rob a monk. He doesn’t rob the royal treasury. He doesn’t work close to home. He’s skilled at hiding his booty.
ai-an8:84.2.4_0: A master thief with these eight factors is not soon executed, and lives long.”
ai-an8:85.1.1_0: “‘Ascetic’ is a term for the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.
ai-an8:85.1.8_0: and ‘Freed’ are terms for the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.
ai-an8:85.2.1_0: The supreme should be attained by an ascetic,
ai-an8:85.2.2_0: a brahmin who has lived the life;
ai-an8:85.2.3_0: it should be attained by a knowledge master,
ai-an8:85.3.1_0: it’d be attained by immeasurable deeds.
ai-an8:85.3.3_0: it should be attained by a knower,
ai-an8:85.4.2_0: Released, I release others from their chains.
ai-an8:85.4.3_0: I am a dragon completely tamed,
ai-an8:85.4.4_0: they’ve become extinguished without anything left over.”
ai-an8:86.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Kosalans together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants when he arrived at a village of the Kosalan brahmins named Icchānaṅgala.
ai-an8:86.1.2_0: He stayed in a forest near Icchānaṅgala.
ai-an8:86.1.3_0: The brahmins and householders of Icchānaṅgala heard:
ai-an8:86.1.4_0: “It seems the ascetic Gotama—a Sakyan, gone forth from a Sakyan family—has arrived at Icchānaṅgala. He is staying in a forest near Icchānaṅgala.
ai-an8:86.1.6_0: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’ ...
ai-an8:86.1.7_0: It’s good to see such perfected ones.”
ai-an8:86.2.1_0: Then, when the night had passed, they took many different foods and went to the forest near Icchānaṅgala.
ai-an8:86.2.1_1: and after going, they making a dreadful racket,
ai-an8:86.2.2_0: Now, at that time Venerable Nāgita was the Buddha’s attendant.
ai-an8:86.2.3_0: Then the Buddha said to Nāgita,
ai-an8:86.2.4_0: “Nāgita, who’s making that dreadful racket? You’d think it was fishermen hauling in a catch!”
ai-an8:86.2.5_0: “Sir, it’s these brahmins and householders of Icchānaṅgala. They’ve brought many different foods, and they’re standing outside the gates wanting to offer it specially to the Buddha and the mendicant Saṅgha.”
ai-an8:86.2.6_0: “Nāgita, may I never become famous. May fame not come to me.
ai-an8:86.2.7_0: There are those who can’t get the bliss of renunciation, the bliss of seclusion, the bliss of peace, the bliss of awakening when they want, without trouble or difficulty.
ai-an8:86.2.7_1: I get the bliss of renunciation, the bliss of seclusion, the bliss of peace, the bliss of awakening when I want, without trouble or difficulty.
ai-an8:86.2.8_0: Let them enjoy the filthy, lazy pleasure of possessions, honor, and popularity.”
ai-an8:86.3.1_0: “Sir, may the Blessed One please relent now! May the Holy One relent!
ai-an8:86.3.2_0: now, reverend Sir, the Fortunate One’s consent
ai-an8:86.3.3_0: Wherever the Buddha now goes, the brahmins and householders will incline the same way, as will the people of town and country.
ai-an8:86.3.4_0: It’s like when the rain falls heavily.
ai-an8:86.3.5_0: In the same way, wherever the Buddha now goes, the brahmins and householders will incline the same way, as will the people of town and country.
ai-an8:86.3.7_0: Because of the Buddha’s ethics and wisdom.”
ai-an8:86.4.1_0: “Nāgita, may I never become famous. May fame not come to me.
ai-an8:86.4.2_0: There are those who can’t get the bliss of renunciation, the bliss of seclusion, the bliss of peace, the bliss of awakening when they want, without trouble or difficulty.
ai-an8:86.4.2_1: I get the bliss of renunciation, the bliss of seclusion, the bliss of peace, the bliss of awakening when I want, without trouble or difficulty.
ai-an8:86.4.3_0: Let them enjoy the filthy, lazy pleasure of possessions, honor, and popularity.
ai-an8:86.5.1_0: Even some of the deities can’t get the bliss of renunciation, the bliss of seclusion, the bliss of peace, the bliss of awakening when they want, without trouble or difficulty like I can.
ai-an8:86.5.2_0: You come together to enjoy the company of such come together.
ai-an8:86.5.3_0: ‘These venerables mustn’t get the bliss of renunciation, the bliss of seclusion, the bliss of peace, the bliss of awakening when they want, without trouble or difficulty.
ai-an8:86.5.3_1: I get the bliss of renunciation, the bliss of seclusion, the bliss of peace, the bliss of awakening when I want, without trouble or difficulty.
ai-an8:86.5.4_0: That must be because they come together to enjoy each other’s company.’
ai-an8:86.6.1_0: Take mendicants I see poking each other with their fingers, giggling and playing together.
ai-an8:86.6.3_0: ‘These venerables mustn’t get the bliss of renunciation, the bliss of seclusion, the bliss of peace, the bliss of awakening when they want, without trouble or difficulty.
ai-an8:86.6.3_1: I get the bliss of renunciation, the bliss of seclusion, the bliss of peace, the bliss of awakening when I want, without trouble or difficulty.
ai-an8:86.6.4_0: That must be because they’re poking each other with their fingers, giggling and playing together.’
ai-an8:86.7.1_0: Take mendicants I see eat as much as they like until their bellies are full, then indulge in the pleasures of sleeping, lying, and drowsing.
ai-an8:86.7.3_0: ‘These venerables mustn’t get the bliss of renunciation, the bliss of seclusion, the bliss of peace, the bliss of awakening when they want, without trouble or difficulty.
ai-an8:86.7.3_1: I get the bliss of renunciation, the bliss of seclusion, the bliss of peace, the bliss of awakening when I want, without trouble or difficulty.
ai-an8:86.7.4_0: That must be because they eat as much as they like until their bellies are full, then indulge in the pleasures of sleeping, lying, and drowsing.’
ai-an8:86.8.1_0: Take a mendicant living in the neighborhood of a village who I see sitting immersed in samādhi.
ai-an8:86.8.3_0: ‘Now a monastery worker, a novice, or a fellow practitioner will make this venerable fall from immersion.
ai-an8:86.8.4_0: So I’m not pleased that that mendicant is living in the neighborhood of a village.
ai-an8:86.9.1_0: Take a mendicant in the wilderness who I see sitting nodding in meditation.
ai-an8:86.9.3_0: ‘Now this venerable, having dispelled that sleepiness and weariness, will focus just on the unified perception of wilderness.’
ai-an8:86.9.4_0: So I’m pleased that mendicant is living in the wilderness.
ai-an8:86.10.1_0: Take a mendicant in the wilderness who I see sitting without being immersed in samādhi.
ai-an8:86.10.3_0: ‘Now if this venerable’s mind is not immersed in samādhi they will immerse it; or if it is immersed in samādhi, they will preserve it.’
ai-an8:86.10.4_0: So I’m pleased that mendicant is living in the wilderness.
ai-an8:86.11.1_0: Take a mendicant in the wilderness who I see sitting without being immersed in samādhi.
ai-an8:86.11.3_0: ‘Now this venerable will free the unfreed mind or preserve the freed mind.’
ai-an8:86.11.4_0: So I’m pleased that mendicant is living in the wilderness.
ai-an8:86.12.1_0: Take a mendicant who I see living in the neighborhood of a village receiving robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
ai-an8:86.12.2_0: Enjoying possessions, honor, and popularity they neglect retreat, and they neglect remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest.
ai-an8:86.12.3_0: They come down to villages, towns and capital cities and make their home there.
ai-an8:86.12.4_0: So I’m not pleased that that mendicant is living in the neighborhood of a village.
ai-an8:86.13.1_0: Take a mendicant who I see in the wilderness receiving robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
ai-an8:86.13.2_0: Having gained possessions, honor, and popularity they don’t neglect retreat, and they don’t frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest.
ai-an8:86.13.3_0: So I’m pleased that mendicant is living in the wilderness.
ai-an8:86.14.1_0: Nāgita, when I’m walking along a road and I don’t see anyone ahead or behind I feel relaxed, even if I need to urinate or defecate.”

ai-an8:87.1.1_0: “Mendicants, the Saṅgha may, if it wishes, turn the bowl upside down for a lay follower on eight grounds.
ai-an8:87.1.3_0: They try to prevent the mendicants from getting material possessions. They try to harm mendicants. They try to drive mendicants from a monastery. They insult and abuse mendicants. They divide mendicants against each other. They criticize the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.
ai-an8:87.1.4_0: The Saṅgha may, if it wishes, turn the bowl upside down for a lay follower on these eight grounds.
ai-an8:87.2.1_0: The Saṅgha may, if it wishes, turn the bowl upright for a lay follower on eight grounds.
ai-an8:87.2.3_0: They don’t try to prevent the mendicants from getting material possessions. They don’t try to harm mendicants. They don’t try to drive mendicants from a monastery. They don’t insult and abuse mendicants. They don’t divide mendicants against each other. They don’t criticize the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.
ai-an8:87.2.4_0: The Saṅgha may, if it wishes, turn the bowl upright for a lay follower on these eight grounds.”
ai-an8:88.1.1_0: “Mendicants, the lay followers may, if they wish, make a proclamation of no confidence in a mendicant who has eight qualities.
ai-an8:88.1.3_0: They try to prevent the lay people from getting material possessions. They try to harm lay people. They insult and abuse lay people. They divide lay people against each other. They criticize the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha. They’re seen at an inappropriate place for collecting alms.
ai-an8:88.1.4_0: The lay followers may, if they wish, make a proclamation of no confidence in a mendicant who has these eight qualities.
ai-an8:88.2.1_0: The lay followers may, if they wish, make a proclamation of confidence in a mendicant who has eight qualities.
ai-an8:88.2.3_0: They don’t try to prevent the lay people from getting material possessions. They don’t try to harm lay people. They don’t insult and abuse lay people. ai-an8:88.2.4_0: The lay followers may, if they wish, make a proclamation of confidence in a mendicant who has these eight qualities.”
ai-an8:89.1.1_0: “Mendicants, the Saṅgha may, if it wishes, perform an act requiring that a mendicant who has eight qualities should pursue reconciliation.
ai-an8:89.1.3_0: They try to prevent the lay people from getting material possessions. They try to harm lay people. They insult and abuse lay people. They divide lay people against each other. ai-an8:89.1.4_0: The Saṅgha may, if it wishes, perform an act requiring that a mendicant who has eight qualities should pursue reconciliation.

ai-an8:89.2.4_0: The Saṅgha may, if it wishes, revoke the act requiring that a mendicant who has eight qualities should pursue reconciliation.”
ai-an8:90.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant who has been convicted of aggravated misconduct must behave themselves properly in eight respects.
ai-an8:90.1.2_0: They must not perform an ordination, give dependence, or be attended by a novice. They must not consent to being appointed as adviser for nuns, and if they are appointed they should not give such advice. They must not consent to any Saṅgha appointment. They must not be put in an isolated place. They must not give rehabilitation in any offense similar to that which they transgressed.
ai-an8:90.1.3_0: A mendicant who has been convicted of aggravated misconduct must behave themselves properly in these eight respects.”

ai-an8:118.1.1_0: “For insight into greed, eight things should be developed.
ai-an8:118.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by eight?

ai-an8:119.1.1_0: “For insight into greed, eight things should be developed.
ai-an8:119.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by eight?
ai-an8:119.1.3_0: Perceiving form internally, they see visions externally, limited, both pretty and ugly.
ai-an8:119.1.4_0: Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’
ai-an8:119.1.5_0: Perceiving form internally, they see visions externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly. ...
ai-an8:119.1.6_0: Not perceiving form internally, they see visions externally, limited, both pretty and ugly. ...

ai-an8:119.1.11_0: Not perceiving form internally, they see visions externally, white, with white color, white hue, and white tint.
ai-an8:119.1.12_0: Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’
ai-an8:119.1.13_0: For insight into greed, these eight things should be developed.”
ai-an8:120.1.1_0: “For insight into greed, eight things should be developed.
ai-an8:120.1.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by eight?
ai-an8:120.1.3_0: Having physical form, they see visions ... not perceiving form internally, they see visions externally ... they’re focused only on beauty ... going totally beyond perceptions of form, with the ending of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, they enter and remain in the dimension of infinite space ... going totally beyond the dimension of infinite space, aware that ‘consciousness is infinite’, they enter and remain in the dimension of infinite consciousness ... going totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness, aware that ‘there is nothing at all’, they enter and remain in the dimension of nothingness ... going totally beyond the dimension of nothingness, they enter and remain in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception ... going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, they enter and remain in the cessation of perception and feeling ...
ai-an8:120.1.4_0: For insight into greed, these eight things should be developed.”
